Name: Metasploit
Description: Software for offensive security teams to help verify vulnerabilities and manage security assessments.

Name: Armitage
Description: Java-based GUI front-end for the Metasploit Framework.

Name: Faraday
Description: Multiuser integrated pentesting environment for red teams performing cooperative penetration tests, security audits, and risk assessments.

Name: ExploitPack
Description: Graphical tool for automating penetration tests that ships with many pre-packaged exploits.

Name: Pupy
Description: Cross-platform (Windows, Linux, macOS, Android) remote administration and post-exploitation tool.

Name: AutoSploit
Description: Automated mass exploiter, which collects targets by employing the Shodan.io API and programmatically chooses Metasploit exploit modules based on the Shodan query.

Name: Decker
Description: Penetration testing orchestration and automation framework, which allows writing declarative, reusable configurations capable of ingesting variables and using outputs of tools it has run as inputs to others.

Name: Cyberwarzone.com IOC Editor
Description: A quick IOC editor so you can send IOC without them being clickable.

Name: Netsparker Application Security Scanner
Description: Application security scanner to automatically find security flaws.

Name: Nexpose
Description: Commercial vulnerability and risk management assessment engine that integrates with Metasploit, sold by Rapid7.

Name: Nessus
Description: Commercial vulnerability management, configuration, and compliance assessment platform, sold by Tenable.

Name: OpenVAS
Description: Free software implementation of the popular Nessus vulnerability assessment system.

Name: Vuls
Description: Agentless vulnerability scanner for GNU/Linux and FreeBSD, written in Go.

Name: Brakeman
Description: Static analysis security vulnerability scanner for Ruby on Rails applications.

Name: cppcheck
Description: Extensible C/C++ static analyzer focused on finding bugs.

Name: FindBugs
Description: Free software static analyzer to look for bugs in Java code.

Name: sobelow
Description: Security-focused static analysis for the Phoenix Framework.

Name: bandit
Description: Security oriented static analyser for python code.

Name: Progpilot
Description: Static security analysis tool for PHP code.

Name: RegEx-DoS
Description: Analyzes source code for Regular Expressions susceptible to Denial of Service attacks.

Name: Netsparker Application Security Scanner
Description: Application security scanner to automatically find security flaws.

Name: Nikto
Description: Noisy but fast black box web server and web application vulnerability scanner.

Name: Arachni
Description: Scriptable framework for evaluating the security of web applications.

Name: w3af
Description: Web application attack and audit framework.

Name: Wapiti
Description: Black box web application vulnerability scanner with built-in fuzzer.

Name: SecApps
Description: In-browser web application security testing suite.

Name: WebReaver
Description: Commercial, graphical web application vulnerability scanner designed for macOS.

Name: WPScan
Description: Black box WordPress vulnerability scanner.

Name: cms-explorer
Description: Reveal the specific modules, plugins, components and themes that various websites powered by content management systems are running.

Name: joomscan
Description: Joomla vulnerability scanner.

Name: ACSTIS
Description: Automated client-side template injection (sandbox escape/bypass) detection for AngularJS.

Name: SQLmate
Description: A friend of sqlmap that identifies sqli vulnerabilities based on a given dork and website (optional).

Name: JCS
Description: Joomla Vulnerability Component Scanner with automatic database updater from exploitdb and packetstorm.

Name: pig
Description: GNU/Linux packet crafting tool.

Name: Intercepter-NG
Description: Multifunctional network toolkit.

Name: SPARTA
Description: Graphical interface offering scriptable, configurable access to existing network infrastructure scanning and enumeration tools.

Name: Zarp
Description: Network attack tool centered around the exploitation of local networks.

Name: dsniff
Description: Collection of tools for network auditing and pentesting.

Name: scapy
Description: Python-based interactive packet manipulation program & library.

Name: hping
Description: Command-line oriented TCP/IP packet assembler/analyzer.

Name: WireShark
Description: A network protocol analyzer for Unix and Windows.

Name: Ettercap
Description: Comprehensive suite for man in the middle attacks.

Name: Yersinia
Description: Network tool designed to take advantage of some weakeness in different network protocols.

Name: netsniff-ng
Description: Swiss army knife for your daily Linux network plumbing.

Name: Autopsy
Description: Digital forensics platform and graphical interface to The Sleuth Kit and other digital forensics tools.

Name: binwalk
Description: Firmware Analysis Tool.

Name: bulk_extractor
Description: Stream-based forensics tool.

Name: chntpw
Description: Utility to reset the password of any user that has a valid local account on your Windows system.

Name: cuckoo
Description: Automated Malware Analysis System.

Name: dc3dd
Description: Patched version of GNU dd with features for forensics and security.

Name: ddrescue
Description: Data recovery tool, trying hard to rescue data in case of read errors.

Name: Dumpzilla
Description: Application to examine the Firefox profile of a suspect during a forensics investigation.

Name: extundelete
Description: Utility to recover deleted files from ext3 or ext4 partitions by parsing the journal.

Name: Foremost
Description: Console program to recover files based on their headers, footers, and internal data structures.

Name: Galleta
Description: A forensics tool that analyzes Internet Explorer cookies.

Name: Guymager
Description: Qt-based forensic imager.

Name: iPhone Backup Analyzer
Description: Graphical tool to analyze the contents of iPhone/iPad/iPod backup files.

Name: p0f
Description: Versatile passive OS fingerprinting, and many other tricks.

Name: pdf-parser
Description: Python script to parse a PDF document to identify the fundamental elements used in the analyzed file.

Name: pdfid
Description: Tool to test a PDF file for exploits.

Name: peepdf
Description: Python tool to analyze and explore PDF files to find out if they can be harmful or not.

Name: RegRipper
Description: Windows registry forensics tool.

Name: Volatility
Description: Advanced memory forensics framework.

Name: Ciphey
Description: Automated decryption tool that uses natural language processing and artificial intelligence, along with some custom algorithms to decrypt data.

Name: Hashcat
Description: World's fastest and most advanced password recovery utility.

Name: John the Ripper
Description: Fast password cracker.

Name: MASKprocessor
Description: High-performance word generator with a per-position configureable charset.

Name: Ncrack
Description: High-speed network authentication cracker.

Name: PACK
Description: Password analysis and cracking kit.

Name: pyrit
Description: Python tool to pre-compute the data needed by aircrack-ng to break WEP and WPA 1/2 passwords.

Name: RainbowCrack
Description: Hash cracker tool that uses a large-scale time-memory trade-off process.

Name: SQLMap
Description: Automatic SQL injection and database takeover tool.

Name: THC-Hydra
Description: Fast and flexible network login hacking tool.

Name: TrueCrack
Description: Password cracking tool that implements brute force attack on TrueCrypt (now VeraCrypt) volumes.

Name: oclHashcat
Description: GPU-accelerated tool to recover passwords.

Name: RSA SecurID Software Token Converter
Description: Converts a SecurID Software Token exported as an XML file to a Comma Separated Values (CSV) file.

Name: RSACTFTOOL
Description: Multi-purpose RSA and ECC toolkit.
